basics.name: Paul Joseph Iannazzo
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: I'm currently a full stack developer, with a lot of emphasis on the front end. I have a love-hate relationship with JavaScript and EMACS. I've been programming since I was in grade school (over 16 years), thus having experience in a lot of languages and tools. Some of which I'm a bit glad that I've forgotten about. I read way too much hacker news, and spend a lot of time on IRC asking for help or giving it

work.summary: Integrated a 3D terrain rendering module I made for his undergraduate class into a much larger project he had. This was all done in C++ for Windows.

Developed a firefox-based-web-crawler to extract SEO data on a, periodically changing, set of sites. Developed reports allowing for quick analysis of output for non-technical users. Technologies used: JavaScript

Data migration from SalesForce to Solve360 CRM. Involved heavy interaction with RESTful interfaces (JSON), data: merging; translation; validation; backups, and API access limit considerations. Technologies used: Clojure; Curl

Explored the Magnolia CMS for a presentation with Astral. Documented typical use-cases. Researched: documentation; community; limitations; common-solutions for limitations; recent developments; success stories. Explored Alfresco DMS. Developed: custom widgets; RESTful web-services; data migration scripts. Researched: methods of code reuse; JSON message passing (separating data from presentation); communication techniques between Alfresco subsystems; using Curl with Alfresco web-services. Technologies used: Magnolia; Alfresco; JavaScript

Lead the database migration from MySQL to CouchDB for the new version of the Point of Sale system that was in development. Lead the design and implementation of the web-based reporting application for the POS system. Optimized CouchDB databases for storage, queries, and bandwidth usage. Technologies used: CouchDB; Clojure; Java; JavaScript; Backbone.js; Underscore.js; JQuery; NodeJS

Developing Front-end and Back-end document management solutions. Technologies used: AngularJS; Backbone; Marionette; aloha.js; pdf.js; Underscore.js; Clojure; NodeJS; Express; Python; Bash; CouchDB; Datomic; RabbitMQ; Vagrant; EC2
AngularJS application development for their frontend. Training junior developers in use of AngularJS. Techonologies used: AngularJS; Bower; Grunt; Underscore.js; ng-boilerplate

volunteer.summary: Misc volunteer work, mostly office hours
Supplying the society with Food as well as managing printing and sales of course notes
Helped aspiring programmers solve their Javascript problems
